repnme.cdata!:
Easing Armenia's transition to a
            market economy

abstracts.cdata!:
With independence in 1991, Armenia
            suffered a severe economic contraction. Between 1990 and
            1993, GDP dropped by more than 50 percent. This led to
            hyperinflation, a budget deficit that reached a high of 55
            percent, factory closures, little electricity supply, and
            large-scale emigration. About 80 percent of the population
            survived on humanitarian assistance and more than half the
            population lived below the poverty line.

docna.cdata!: Transicion de Armenia hacia una economia de mercado

display_title.display_title:
Easing Armenia's transition
            to a market economy : Transicion de Armenia hacia una
            economia de mercado

repnme.cdata!:
Easing Armenia's transition to a
            market economy

abstracts.cdata!:
With independence in 1991, Armenia
            suffered a severe economic contraction. Between 1990 and
            1993, GDP dropped by more than 50 percent. This led to
            hyperinflation, a budget deficit that reached a high of 55
            percent, factory closures, little electricity supply, and
            large-scale emigration. About 80 percent of the population
            survived on humanitarian assistance and more than half the
            population lived below the poverty line.

repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Fourth Structural Adjustment
            Credit (SAC IV) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Fourth Structural
            Adjustment Credit for Armenia were as follows: the outcome
            was satisfactory, the sustainability was highly likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate that it is very helpful to social
            sector proponents when the Bank negotiates for higher budget
            allocations to social sectors. In interviews with nationals,
            they report that the structural adjustment operations are
            influential in gaining higher allocations and preventing
            under-funding of social sectors. Structural Adjustment
            Credit (SAC5) has incorporated this lesson in its design by
            obtaining agreement to increase the health and education
            budgets by 27.0 and 14.4 percent from 2002 to 2003,
            respectively. Strong TA resources are essential for
            successful reform program implementation, particularly
            during the second, more detailed phase of reforms. It has
            been a matter of practice for Bank TA credits to support
            Armenian adjustment operations. Without the accompanying
            Structural Adjustment Technical Assistance Credit (SATAC2),
            the design and implementation of SAC4 would have been much
            less geared to national priorities and fewer of the high
            impact measures would have been identified. In fact, the
            SATAC2 was restructured specifically to support the new
            program focus on improved business climate supported by
            SAC4. Bilateral TA was also important in a number of areas
            including privatization of the Energy Distribution Company
            (EDC), legal drafting, and preparation of pension reform. At
            times it is very difficult to find investors to buy
            utilities, such as at the time of the SAC4, and putting them
            up for sale can be risky. Under these circumstances, the
            Bank should explore new ways of combining the financing and
            expertise required to privatize. As long as the ultimate
            objective to transfer ownership of the utility and improve
            efficiency is achieved, it should not matter that the
            privatization was not carried out in a conventional way
            under ideal conditions with a well-funded, high expertise
            strategic investor.

docna.cdata!:
Armenia - Fourth Structural Adjustment
            Credit (SAC IV) Project

display_title.display_title:
Armenia - Fourth Structural
            Adjustment Credit (SAC IV) Project
